summary: This lesson covers the seven levels of agentic prompt formats and introduces the stakeholder trifecta: you, your team, and your agents. The prompt is now the fundamental unit of engineering - one well-crafted prompt can generate hundreds of hours of productive work. The lesson presents prompt sections as composable Lego blocks: Title, High-Level Prompt, Workflow/Steps, Report/Output Format, Variables, Examples, Relevant Files, Codebase Structure, and Template Meta Prompts. These are ranked in a tier list by usefulness and skill required. Template Meta Prompts (S-tier) are the most powerful - prompts that generate other prompts. The goal is building libraries of reusable, battle-tested agentic prompts that scale engineering impact with compute.
key_concepts:
1. THE STAKEHOLDER TRIFECTA: Engineering for three audiences - You, Your Team, Your Agents. This is the agentic shift most engineers have not made.

2. PROMPT AS FORCE MULTIPLIER: The prompt is the fundamental unit of engineering. One well-crafted prompt generates tens to hundreds of hours of productive work. One bad prompt compounds failure.

3. SEVEN LEVELS OF PROMPT FORMATS: Prompts stack in complexity from simple (Title + High-Level) to advanced (Template Meta Prompts). Each level adds new sections.

4. COMPOSABLE SECTIONS (LEGO BLOCKS): Title, High-Level Prompt, Workflow/Steps, Report/Output, Variables, Examples, Relevant Files, Codebase Structure, Template Meta Prompts.

5. TIER LIST RANKING: Sections ranked by usefulness and skill required. Template Meta Prompts are S-tier (highest). Variables and Examples are A-tier. Relevant Files and basic sections are C-tier.

6. TEMPLATE META PROMPTS (S-TIER): The most powerful prompt type - prompts that generate other prompts. Unlock this skill to scale your agentic engineering exponentially.

7. WORKFLOW PROMPTS: Execute a series of steps that can get very complex and call many tools. The foundation for multi-step agent operations.

8. REPORT/OUTPUT FORMAT: Specify exactly how you want results formatted. Drastically increases agent performance without requiring much skill.

9. VARIABLES: Dynamic placeholders that make prompts reusable across different contexts. High usefulness, moderate skill to implement well.

10. REUSABLE PROMPT LIBRARIES: Build battle-tested agentic prompts with composable sections. Swap sections in and out like Lego blocks to scale engineering impact with compute.
